messages.message:
*OCR Update:*

Hi Team,

I am excited to announce that we now have support for *Microsoft Read 3.2* in *Dogfood*. Read 3.2 is nice upgrade over the Read 2.0 version we are currently using, and will offer a number of new features and improvements:
• *Improved OCR Quality*: Read 3.2 uses a completely new underlying model, which should provide more accurate results and be able to read documents that previously were too low quality to OCR.
• *Numeric Confidence Scores*: Unlike Read 2.0 which just tells us if a word is “low_confidence”, 3.2 provides a word confidence score between 0.0 and 1.0 for each word on the page. This new field is now accessible in the IBDoc.
• *More Language Support*: Read 2.0 only supports English, but is able to do fairly well with any language that uses the Latin alphabet. Read 3.2 has support for 73 different languages (https://docs.microsoft.com/en-us/azure/cognitive-services/computer-vision/language-support#optical-character-recognition-ocr), including symbolic and character based languages.
*How do you use Read 3.2 on Instabase?*
Right now, the setting to enable this in hidden in the OcrCfg of Process Files, by adding this setting:
``` "model_specific_settings": {
  "marx_v1": {
   "version": "v3"
  }
 }```
This setting is not final. If and when we start using this more and deploying to customers, we will make it more discoverable, likely as an additional OCR Model.

*Can we use this for Customers?*
*No.* Read 3.2 on Instabase is currently available for *internal testing only*. After some initial load tests, it seems that the 3.2 containers use *4x the CPU and ~2x the Memory to get comparable latency performance to Read 2.0 containers*. We are working with the Microsoft team to try to decrease these resource requirements, but for now we look at this as a *hard blocker for deploying this to any of our customers*. Dogfood is currently using the Azure Cloud Read 3.2 API instead of the Read 3.2 container, so performance on Dogfood will not be representative of what it would be in a real environment.

Let me know if there are any questions or any bugs. Would love to get some feedback on this!
are we going to support customers that are comfortable with sending their data to azure?
